docs.abstract: Although patients often hear otherwise, Medicare does not require that they improve to keep receiving certain kinds of therapy.
docs.snippet: Although patients often hear otherwise, Medicare does not require that they improve to keep receiving certain kinds of therapy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Luxottica Group, owner of brands like Ray-Ban, Oakley and manager of retail chains like LensCrafters and Sunglass Hut, will design, produce and sell frames for Google Glass, the wearable computer.

headline.main: Biggest Eyewear Company Signs On With Google Glass
headline.print_headline: Biggest Eyewear Company Signs On With Google Glass

docs.abstract: Google announces partnership with Luxottica Group, largest eyeglass company in world, to design, manufacture and distribute frames for Google Glass, Internet-connected eyewear.
docs.snippet: Luxottica Group, owner of brands like Ray-Ban, Oakley and manager of retail chains like LensCrafters and Sunglass Hut, will design, produce and sell frames for Google Glass, the wearable computer.

docs.lead_paragraph: In “The Junket,” a solo show at the Lynn Redgrave Theater, Mike Albo talks about a trip that cost him his freelance writing arrangement with The New York Times.

headline.seo: ‘The Junket,’ Mike Albo’s Take on the Freelancer’s Life
headline.main: A Freebie That Proved Quite Costly
headline.print_headline: A Freebie That Proved Quite Costly

docs.abstract: Frank Rizzo reviews solo theater piece The Junket, written and performed by Mike Albo at the Lynn Redgrave Theater.
docs.snippet: In “The Junket,” a solo show at the Lynn Redgrave Theater, Mike Albo talks about a trip that cost him his freelance writing arrangement with The New York Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Las Vegas entertainer who works a variety of jobs finds she must reinvent herself.

headline.main: Freelancers Piece Together a Living in the Temp Economy

docs.abstract: Millions of Americans piece together a living with freelance and temporary work, and self-employment; Government Accountability Offices estimates about 14 million were self-employed in February, including freelancers; Labor Bureau says number of people paid by temp agencies has grown 46 percent since 2009.
docs.snippet: A Las Vegas entertainer who works a variety of jobs finds she must reinvent herself.

docs.lead_paragraph: Insurers are hosting events and activities to try to attract hard-to-reach groups and people who had trouble enrolling on their own.

headline.main: Insurers Push to Enroll People as Health Care Deadline Nears
headline.print_headline: A Final Push for Health Care

docs.abstract: Health insurers are scrambling to sign up holdouts for Affordable Care Act, using all sorts of marketing tools, before deadline on March 31; companies are hosting events and activities to try to attract hard-to-reach groups and people who had trouble enrolling on their own.
docs.snippet: Insurers are hosting events and activities to try to attract hard-to-reach groups and people who had trouble enrolling on their own.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study shows that affluent counties have experienced the biggest declines in smoking rates, while progress in the poorest ones has stagnated.

headline.main: Smoking Proves Hard to Shake Among the Poor
headline.print_headline: In a New Divide, Smoking Is Becoming a Habit of the Poor

docs.abstract: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation analysis of federal data shows that smoking is increasingly becoming habit of poor Americans; study shows affluent counties have experienced biggest declines in smoking rates, while progress in poorest ones has stagnated.
docs.snippet: A new study shows that affluent counties have experienced the biggest declines in smoking rates, while progress in the poorest ones has stagnated.

byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Manchester, and Robert Gebeloff from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: A case before the Supreme Court could lead to broader religious exemptions from laws on health and civil rights.

headline.main: Ruling Could Have Reach Beyond Issue of Contraception
headline.print_headline: Ruling Could Have Reach Beyond Issue of Insurance

docs.abstract: Supreme Court is to hear arguments in case that pits religious liberty against women's rights; question directly before court is whether for-profit corporations must provide insurance coverage for contraception, which is requirement of Affordable Care Act; Hobby Lobby challenged requirement; ruling could lead to broader religious exemptions from laws on health and civil rights.
docs.snippet: A case before the Supreme Court could lead to broader religious exemptions from laws on health and civil rights.

docs.abstract: The private equity firm is taking a new approach, moving beyond the gigantic acquisitions and, instead, looking more at buying minority stakes.
docs.snippet: The private equity firm is taking a new approach, moving beyond the gigantic acquisitions and, instead, looking more at buying minority stakes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday considers whether business owners can object on religious grounds to a provision of President Barack Obama's healthcare law that requires employers to provide health insurance that covers birth control.
